description.#cdata-section: CNBC International is the world leader for news on business, technology, China, trade, oil prices, the Middle East and markets.

item.title: Tech layoffs balloon in January as Wall Street rally lifts Alphabet, Meta, Microsoft to records

description.#cdata-section: So far in January, some 23,670 workers have been laid off, the most in any month since March, according to the website Layoffs.fyi.

item.title: Beijing intensifies military pressure on Taiwan as U.S.-China talks resume

description.#cdata-section: President Biden expressed support for Taiwan's status quo sovereignty in a November meeting with Chinese President Xi Jinping.

item.title: A handful of space companies are running out of cash and time. Here are three at risk

description.#cdata-section: While many space companies battened the hatches to survive, a few publicly-traded names are running on fumes.

item.title: How the Apple iPhone became one of the best-selling products of all time
Skipping breakfast isn’t as harmless as you may think—here are 2 surprising reasons why

description.#cdata-section: Research suggests that skipping breakfast may be more harmful than you think. Here are two reasons why breakfast is the most important meal of the day.

item.title: U.S. workers are getting scooped up by international companies hiring remote roles

description.#cdata-section: The number of American workers hired by international companies grew 62% last year.

item.title: Apple takes top spot in China's smartphone market for the first time as Huawei returns to the top 5

description.#cdata-section: Apple took the top spot in China's smartphone market in 2023 even as it faces renewed competition from domestic giant Huawei.

item.title: Stock market to 'nowhere?' Two ETF experts see more trouble ahead in China

description.#cdata-section: Why investors may find it tough to see a growth story in China this year.

item.title: Saudi Arabia's first alcohol store is a big step, but also aims to tackle a longstanding problem: Booze smuggling

description.#cdata-section: "Everyone knows which embassies sell booze … some of them have made a whole side business out of it," one Saudi investor told CNBC.

item.title: Activist Rubric nominates two directors at Xperi. Here’s how the firm may help enhance shareholder value

description.#cdata-section: There are opportunities for cost cutting at Xperi, and fresh blood on the board might be what it takes to build value.

item.title: How Guyana's big oil boom turned it into the world's fastest-growing economy

description.#cdata-section: The 2015 oil discovery led Guyana to become the world's fastest-growing economy, recording the world's highest real GDP growth rate in 2022 and 2023.

item.title: Fed's favorite inflation gauge rose 0.2% in December and was up 2.9% from a year ago

description.#cdata-section: The core personal consumption expenditures price index was expected to increase 0.2% monthly in December and 3% from a year ago.

item.title: Jury rules Trump must pay E. Jean Carroll $83.3 million in damages for defamation

description.#cdata-section: The massive defamation verdict against Donald Trump in favor of E. Jean Carroll came less than three hours after jurors began deliberating in New York.

item.title: Intel has worst day since 2020 on weak outlook

description.#cdata-section: Intel's revenue guidance for the first quarter was below every analyst's estimate.

item.title: Jürgen Klopp announces shock Liverpool soccer club exit in blow for U.S. owners

description.#cdata-section: Jürgen Klopp will step down as Liverpool manager at the end of this season, the club announced Friday.

item.title: Tesla recalls nearly 200,000 vehicles in the U.S. over rearview camera bug

description.#cdata-section: Tesla is recalling nearly 200,000 cars due to a software bug that prevented the rearview camera image from displaying, U.S. safety regulators said Friday.

item.title: LVMH shares jump over 12% as earnings point to luxury sector resilience

description.#cdata-section: LVMH shares jumped more than 12% on Friday morning after the world's largest luxury group posted higher-than-expected sales for 2023 and raised its annual dividend.

item.title: UK opens antitrust probe into Vodafone merger with CK Hutchison's Three mobile network

description.#cdata-section: Britain's competition watchdog said it is opening a probe into the proposed merger between Vodafone and the Three UK mobile network owned by CK Hutchison.

item.title: U.S. and China are working to make the business environment less volatile, Beijing says

description.#cdata-section: China and the U.S. are working toward creating a more predictable environment for businesses, Chinese Commerce Minister Wang Wentao said Friday.

item.title: Shein rejects Amazon 'clone' talk ahead of closely watched U.S. listing

description.#cdata-section: Shein is not positioning itself as an Amazon "clone" ahead of its hotly anticipated U.S. public listing later this year, the company's head of strategic communications told CNBC.

item.title: Baidu's Ernie AI chatbot to power Samsung's new Galaxy S24 smartphones

description.#cdata-section: Chinese tech giant Baidu will partner Samsung to integrate its Ernie chatbot capabilities into Galaxy S24 smartphones.

item.title: 'Unshirkable responsibility': China's financial institutions urged to support property developers

description.#cdata-section: Beijing announced measures to ease the cash crunch in the crucial real estate sector that's been hard hit by a crackdown on debt levels.

item.title: Commodity markets are in a 'super squeeze' — and higher prices could be here to stay

description.#cdata-section: Global commodity markets are in a "super squeeze" amid supply disruptions and lack of investment — and it's only going to get worse, said HSBC's Paul Bloxham.

item.title: Top business leaders bemoan archaic systems in Europe that are curbing climate solutions

description.#cdata-section: There needs to be a regulatory framework in place that helps companies make “bolder” moves, said one CEO.

item.title: Religious trips will fuel India’s tourism boom — airlines are gearing up with record aircraft orders

description.#cdata-section: India's tourism sector is set for a boom powered by religious trips — Indian carriers have placed orders for more than 1,100 planes over the past eight months.

item.title: Taiwan's political disrupter could be kingmaker in a split parliament. Here's why it matters

description.#cdata-section: While Ko Wen-je lost the presidential election, his Taiwan People's Party won 8 seats in the new legislature where the major parties have no clear majority.

item.title: Microsoft lays off 1,900 workers, nearly 9% of gaming division, after Activision Blizzard acquisition

description.#cdata-section: The Microsoft layoffs come a little more than three months after the company closed on its acquisition of video game maker Activison Blizzard.

item.title: Tesla shares close down 12% after automaker warns of slowdown

description.#cdata-section: Tesla said vehicle volume growth in 2024 "may be notably lower" than last year's growth rate.

item.title: The U.S. economy grew at blistering 3.3% pace in Q4 while inflation pulled back

description.#cdata-section: GDP was expected to grow at a 2% annualized rate in the fourth quarter of 2023, according to economists surveyed by Dow Jones.

item.title: China is ramping up stimulus to boost market confidence — but is it enough?

description.#cdata-section: There are rising expectations for more support from China to boost its economy and stock markets — especially after the PBOC's easing announcements on Wednesday.
